reviewText: I like the program, but I am hoping Amazon's prices will come down to be competitive with Ebay's. - $400+ for one DVD seems ridiculous.

This is an extensive, multi-faceted video program filmed throughout the Spanish-speaking world to fully support the culture and language presented in each lesson of Avancemos! Level 1. It includes a vocabulary presentation video, some cheesy, ongoing Telehistorias, and also some comparacin cultural videos. An additional video program, El gran desafo, begins in Level 2 and extends into Level 3. My students really look forward to watching these short cheesy videos. Each one is about 1-2 minutes long. It does a pretty good job of using the textbook's vocabulary and grammar in context. I always use the Spanish (not English) subtitles option. The DVD also has bloopers too, although I haven't watched them yet. The good news is that you actually don't have to purchase this DVD at all, if you would like to view these videos they are all online at classzone.com >find the avancemos textbook >download video files. They are poor quality, but free!
This video supplements the Avancemos! text perfectly.  Includes vocabulary and telehistoria video segments.  Subtitles also available in Spanish and English.

This looks to be a good program, but you shouldn't overlook the student text and online website to achieve the most value.  The DVD offers units 1-8 which work in conjunction with Advancemos! 1 text.  There are both English and Spanish subtitles available.

It went a bit fast for me, and I had to pause it at times.  This probably wouldn't have been the case if I'd worked with the audio clips, animated exercises, and flashcards that are available at classzone.com.

I recommend getting the text, and exploring the associated website.
